results.title: Surrounded: peer group membership
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of two members of an adolescent group who each for different reasons does not wish to attend a weekend holiday with the others. Shows how they handle the pressure exerted on them by the other members of the group to conform. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: South with Shackleton (1914)
results.creator_credit: Richard Robinson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. results.title: Luchak's Easter
results.creator_credit: Robert Klymasz, National Film Board of Canada and National Museum of Man
results.brief_description: A Ukrainian Easter tradition is celebrated by a Ukrainian-Canadian family in Alberta. Coinciding with the time of Christ’s Resurrection, ceremonies are held in anticipation of the resurrection of those ancestors who have died. The family graveyard is decorated, religious rites are performed, and a family feast is held.

results.title: Kathy's pacing horse
results.brief_description: Looks at the life style of seventeen-year-old Kathy Sargent who lives in a sheep station in southwest Western Australia.

results.title: How to be a professional mum or dad
results.brief_description: Examines strategies of Glenn Doman at the institute for the realization of Human Potential in America on development of learning in children in the first six years of life. Shows parents and children following his theories on the unlimited potential of children for absorbing knowledge.

results.title: An Everyday miracle
results.brief_description: Shows the use of ultrasound and microphotography to determine intra uterine health from conception to birth. Narrated by Sir David Attenborough, this documentary has incredible shots of the developing foetus.

results.title: One man's history: Orwell's 'Animal farm'
results.creator_credit: Andree Molyneux and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Tries to examine some of George Orwell’s motives when he wrote his famous political fable “Animal farm”, by contrasting scenes from Halas and Batchelor’s cartoon feature film with archive film of political life in Russia between the wars.
results.description: Tries to examine some of George Orwell’s motives when he wrote his famous political fable “Animal farm”, by contrasting scenes from Halas and Batchelor’s cartoon feature film with archive film of political life in Russia between the wars.

results.title: The Whale savers
results.creator_credit: Alex Dumas, Laurie Levy, Neal Bethune and Levy-Bethune Productions
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the work of conservationists Laurie Levy and Neal Bethune established the Whale Rescue Centre in Melbourne. They argue against the view that whales mass suicide and stress attempts should be made to save them. Includes footage of both successful and unsucessful attempts to rescue stranded whales on the Victorian and Tasmanian coasts. Narrated by Lynda Stoner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Dumas, Laurie Levy, Neal Bethune and Levy-Bethune Productions
results.description: Presents an overview of the work of conservationists Laurie Levy and Neal Bethune established the Whale Rescue Centre in Melbourne. results.title: China's child
results.brief_description: Looks at population control measures implemented in China and economic and sociological implications of these. Couples must be over twenty-four years of age before marrying and are told when to conceive a child.

results.title: Eye of the octopus
results.creator_credit: James Siers, Judy Siers and Sierpinski Films
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of a 13 year old New Zealand boy who lives for a summer with the people of Kiribati, a remote Pacific island and learns their customs. He learns fishing, snorkelling, sailing, and survival techniques. Finally he must capture and kill an octopus in the customary manner.
